page.title: 05TIVERTON SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: The{sewage works}was rebuilt at {Hollywell}in 1968 to cater for 16,000 people in{Tiverton and Bolham. Preliminary treatment removes grit and grease and macerates paper and rags. The sewage flow goes to 4 primary settlement tanks where sludge is removed and on to 2 biological filter beds. The effluent is distributed by travelling pipes onto a 6 foot deep bed of blast furnace slag. This supports a biological film which purifies by oxidation. The effluent is purified by further filtering before being{discharged into the river Exe. The sludge is conditioned by lime and made into agricultural fertiliser. Most of these processes are governed electrically by a central control room. Extensions to the works are planned in the next two years.
